levels.title: Contour & Gesture Fundamentals
levels.description: Train the hand to follow the eye. Learn rhythm, flow, proportion.
levels.prompt: Draw 10 objects using only continuous contour lines. Then draw 10 gesture sketches of moving subjects.

levels.title: Measuring & Proportion
levels.description: Develop accuracy through sight-size, comparative measurement, and angle checking.
levels.prompt: Pick a simple still life (mug, book, sphere). Create three drawings: blind contour, measured block-in, refined line.

levels.title: Light Logic Study
levels.description: Learn the 5-value system: light, midtone, core shadow, reflected light, cast shadow.
levels.prompt: Shade a sphere, cube, and cylinder from a single light source in black and white.

levels.title: Object Rendering
levels.description: Understand how light interacts with surface textures.
levels.prompt: Render three objects with distinct textures (metal, fruit, fabric).

levels.title: Linear Perspective Mastery
levels.description: 1-point, 2-point, 3-point perspective; horizon line awareness; scale shifts.
levels.prompt: Draw a simple room from imagination in 1-point, then the same room in 2-point.

levels.title: Atmospheric & Spatial Depth
levels.description: Convey distance using value, edge control, simplification.
levels.prompt: Create a landscape emphasizing foreground/midground/background contrast.

levels.title: Gesture Mastery
levels.description: Capture life, energy, and weight in under 60 seconds.
levels.prompt: Do 30 gesture drawings using reference or live models.

levels.title: Mannequinization & Structure
levels.description: Break the body into simple forms (boxes, cylinders) to learn construction.
levels.prompt: Draw 10 standing poses and 10 dynamic poses using simple 3D forms only.

levels.title: Torso & Ribcage Study
levels.description: Learn skeletal landmarks, ribcage tilt, pelvis rotations.
levels.prompt: Draw 15 torso studies focusing on ribcage–pelvis relationship.

levels.title: Limbs & Hands
levels.description: Understand proportion, joint mechanics, foreshortening.
levels.prompt: 10 arm studies, 10 leg studies, 10 hands, 5 feet.

levels.title: Animal Construction
levels.description: Learn how different skeletal structures translate to forms.
levels.prompt: Choose 3 animals; draw their skeleton, simple forms, then a rendered study.

levels.title: Creature Design Using Real Anatomy
levels.description: Combine anatomical rules creatively.
levels.prompt: Design an original creature using the structure of two real animals.

levels.title: Drapery Logic
levels.description: Study folds: pipe, zigzag, spiral, tension, inert, diagonal.
levels.prompt: Set up a cloth still life. Draw each fold type intentionally.

levels.title: Costumed Figure Study
levels.description: Understand how clothing interacts with form beneath.
levels.prompt: Draw a figure in layered clothing, showing structure through folds.

levels.title: Thumbnail Composition Mastery
levels.description: Learn rule of thirds, balance, focal points, value grouping.
levels.prompt: Make 20 small thumbnails for a scene. Choose the strongest and refine it.

levels.title: Notan & Value Design
levels.description: Simplify complex images into black/white for clarity.
levels.prompt: Take three reference images. Turn each into a 2-value notan, then a 4-value design.

levels.title: Narrative Moments
levels.description: Convey action, emotion, and intention in a single frame.
levels.prompt: Create a drawing that captures a 'moment in time' — just before or after an event.

levels.title: Character Interaction
levels.description: Show dynamics using body language, staging, and silhouette.
levels.prompt: Draw two characters whose relationship is clear without words.

levels.title: Multi-Medium Sprint
levels.description: Learn adaptability and discover preferences.
levels.prompt: Create one drawing each in pencil, ink, marker, charcoal, digital lineart, and digital painting.

levels.title: Texture & Brushwork
levels.description: Develop a vocabulary of mark-making.
levels.prompt: Create a page of textures/marks using 5 different techniques or tools.

levels.title: Style Deconstruction
levels.description: Analyze 3 artists you admire. Understand choices rather than copying outcomes.
levels.prompt: Break down each artist’s shapes, values, color logic, edges, exaggerations.

levels.title: Synthesis Experiments
levels.description: Combine your influences intentionally.
levels.prompt: Create 3 pieces, each mixing two different stylistic ideas.

levels.title: Multi-Figure Composition
levels.description: Integrate anatomy, depth, lighting, and storytelling.
levels.prompt: Create a drawing containing at least three characters interacting.

levels.title: Environment + Character Integration
levels.description: Ensure the environment supports narrative and mood.
levels.prompt: Draw a main character placed inside a complex environment with consistent perspective and lighting.

levels.title: Preliminary Studies
levels.description: Use the classical workflow: thumbnails → sketches → value comps → color comps.
levels.prompt: Choose a theme meaningful to you. Create a full cycle of preparatory work.

levels.title: Final Masterwork
levels.description: Apply everything you’ve learned.
levels.prompt: Create a polished, exhibition-level piece in any medium. Minimum 20+ hours.
